getToolName

public java.lang.String getToolName(java.lang.String ID)
Description copied from interface: ToolAddonFactory
Should return a short human readable name of the tool which corresponds to the given ID. If the addon does not support tools with the given ID, null should be returned. The name may or may not consist of sub-strings separated by slashes (e.g. "Misc/Foo"). The last string corresponds to the base name. In this case, a client may or may not display some kind of folder structure to navigate to a given addon.

Specified by:
getToolName in interface ToolAddonFactory
Parameters:
ID - The ID of the tool for which the human readable name should be returned.
Returns:
Human readable name of the tool.

getSupportedToolFunctionalities

public java.lang.String[] getSupportedToolFunctionalities(java.lang.String toolID)
Description copied from interface: ToolAddonFactory
A tool can expose here which functionalities it supports. Different to tool IDs, which have to be unique for every tool, several tools can implement the same functionality. Instead of directly searching for a given tool, other tools (and parts of YouScope) can search for tools implementing a given functionality. This allows other tools to implement a policy of "I don't care how it is done, as long as it is done". Supporting a functionality is similar to implementing an interface in Java, except that the exact interface definition is by convention only. A given functionality can either correspond to an empty interface (e.g. to Serializable), indicating that the tool can be used for a certain task (e.g. to display the stage position), or to an interface with methods. In the latter case, the respective tool should implement the methods in callMethod() and getMethodDescriptions() which are defined for the functionality by convention. The creator of a tool is responsible to make the definition, methods and description of a functionality available for the public, as well as to take care that the name of a functionality does not collide with the name of another functionality.

Specified by:
getSupportedToolFunctionalities in interface ToolAddonFactory
Parameters:
toolID - ID of the tool for which the supported functionalities should be queried.
Returns:
Array of functionality names. Empty array if no functionality is supported. If a tool with the given ID is not supported by this factory, should return an empty array.

supportsToolFunctionality

public boolean supportsToolFunctionality(java.lang.String toolID,
                                         java.lang.String functionality)
Description copied from interface: ToolAddonFactory
Queries the tool if it supports a functionality with the given name, i.e. if the array returned by getSupportedToolFunctionalities() contains the given functionality. Remark: Functionality names are not case dependent.

Specified by:
supportsToolFunctionality in interface ToolAddonFactory
Parameters:
toolID - The ID of the tool for which the human readable name should be returned.
Returns:
true if the tool with the given ID supports the functionality, false otherwise. If a tool with the given ID is not supported by this factory, should return false.
